intro: Corydalis griffithii subsp. salangensis, commonly known as the Salangian Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. The plant features slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
